word.literal: to get straight to the point

sentence.idiomatic: I like to come straight to the point. Whatever you have to say, just say it.

word.literal: to get straight to the point
to head straight to the theme

sentence.idiomatic: His speech came straight to the point. He headed straight to the theme--no cliched speech or empty talk.

word.literal: to get straight to the point

sentence.idiomatic: Chinese people are more reserved--a lot of the time they don't like to come straight to the point.
He has accumulated an abundance of competitive experience in games both large and small.
Some years ago he accumulated a large amount of capital through stock speculation.
He's already been in this profession for over 10 years, and has accumulated deep personal relationships.
If an enterprise wants to expand, the key is to give free rein to the employees' initiative and creativity.
As an outstanding leader, one must know how to put the team's abilities to the greatest use.
He is very eloquent. Letting him host the talk show will let him put his special aptitude to use.
He hasn't been with this company very long, his record of service is not extensive.
I feel that based on your qualifications, you are completely qualified for this job.
The records of service for the two of them are equally good. The boss doesn't know who to promote.
My secretary is very meticulous in her work, and also very responsible.
She cut her hair short, it looks very neat and tidy.
The way he mounted the horse was very nimble and graceful. As soon as I saw that I knew he was an equestrian expert.
Xiao Wang is a very unselfish person, he never haggles over personal losses.
As a businessman, he is accustomed to putting profit gains in first place.
My understanding of success and failure is this: where there are gains, there are losses.

word.literal: to be unable to bear hardship

sentence.idiomatic: He went to Shaolin Temple to study martial arts on a moment's whim. Because he was unable to bear the hardship, he very quickly gave up.
I'm sorry, I was seized by a sudden impulse, and said inappropriate things.
Because of his moment of carelessness, he narrowly missed causing the company huge losses.
He has served on the team for ten years--he is the key person on the team.
Please give me an opportunity to serve the company. I will definitely do a good job.
He is a domestic sports star. Formerly, he served on many top-ranking clubs.
Hello, Mr. Liu. I'm honored to meet you.

word.literal: to get straight to the point

sentence.idiomatic: Hi, and I'm happy you've come in for the interview. Let's get right down to the point. Why are you applying for this position?

I've been doing marketing all along, and I've accumulated a certain amount of experience I can draw upon. The position of marketing manager would allow me to put my skills to use, while also bringing value to the company.
Your record is pretty good, a top-ranked student from a big-name school. You've also worked at a multi-national. But you've never played a management role.
There's a starting point for everything. And what I appreciate most is this company's culture of giving newcomers time in the spotlight.
Well, that's good. What do you think the most important principle of management is?
Seeing problems from others' point of view.
Simple and skillful. Very good! To be honest, Ms. Li, you're well suited to this position. But your salary requirements are a little high.
You're clear about my record. I am absolutely worth that salary.

Ms. Li, your expectations are just too much higher than what we've budgeted. Our offer is competitive within the industry. Besides, our benefits are very good, and our yearly raise figures are very high.
Mr. Liu, I am steadfast in all that I do. Towards my job, as well as towards my ideas.
Ms. Li, you need to think long-term. Don't abandon future development over a moment's gain.
I hope that you could do the same, because my perseverance is not without reason.
All right, let's stop here then. After I consider it I'll have the secretary contact you.
Thank you, Mr. Liu. I hope I can serve you.

word.literal: to get straight to the point
